reviews.review: Loved the guessing who did it throughout
Pleasantly surprised! This movie was much better than I imagined it would be and it isn't predictable at all. Loved the plot twist! I'm going to see it again this weekend!
Loved it! Great murder mystery with a bunch of twists.
Amazing, unique reinvention of the classic murder mystery. Fantastic performances. Witty, fun, and unexpected. Loved it and definitely a must see!
While advertised as big laughs, which is very true once you understand what youre laughing at, it takes a bit to truly get the jokes.  Once you get it you are hooked.  Follow Mr. Bond
One of the best of the year. It's so much fun and Daniel Craig is brilliant, hell the whole cast is great

One of the smartest and wittiest crafted crime "Who Dun it?" dramas in many, many years. With Brick, Looper, Star Wars: The Last Jedi and now Knives Out on his mantle-- Rian Johnson solidifies himself as one the premier best writer/directors in this era of Hollywood filmmaking.

Knives Out is an elegant murder mystery that manages to keep ahead of even the savviest of audiences. I find mysteries often have to do a little cheating to keep its audience off balance, but not so here. Knives Out doles out huge reveals early on, only to keep the mystery afoot with some clever narrative backtracking and subtle dialogue that keeps the audience guessing as to the characters motivations.

I wont say more about the plot. Daniel Craig is superb as the last of the gentleman detectives, as one character puts it, whose delightfully over-the-top southern accent sets the tone for the rest of the cast. Other standouts are Jaime Lee Curtis and Michael Shannon. Finally, Ana de Armas anchors the movie as the hapless nurse ensnared in a dysfunctional family feud.

More than just a murder mystery, Knives Out clearly has something to say about what unchecked privilege can do to the soul, a message that should click with modern audiences.

I dont usually gush, but this was a fun movie. Check it out.
It was clever, well-directed, and well-performed. I look forward to re-watching it to catch all of the details I missed the first time around. It's definitely a keeper.
